Posts.Content: Hi. Sorry not sure about swimsuits but Matalan and Asda do a good range of bikinis which have little holes in the cups into which i squash my swimming knitted knocker. Buy the bandeau type top and no one will know a thing. Have a lovely time in Portugal. xx
Posts.Title: Post Mastectomy Swimwear

Posts.Content: Thank you for your input everyone. I think I will try the first injection and see how I feel. Like you say Lynn anything is better than a recurrence.
Posts.Title: biphosphonates

Posts.Content: Has anyone tried biphosphonates to prevent recurrence in the bones. My oncologist said yesterday I can try them if I would like to. She said it would be an injection twice a year. I am not sure now whether to try them or not. I believe it is a 3% reduction of recurrence but with bad side effects. I would welcome any opinions please
Posts.Title: biphosphonates

Posts.Content: Hi. Just an update. I had my first infusion of biphosphonates yesterday by infusion and so far have had no side effects at all. I drank about 3  litres of water yesterday like i did during chemo so perhaps this helped.
Posts.Title: biphosphonates

Posts.Content: Hi Bon Do you mind me asking how the osteonecrosis of the jaw manifested itself ? I have just started on 6 monthly biphosphanate infusions this month and that was the thing that worried me most. Had no side effects at all after the first infusion which was about 3 weeks ago. Thanks Dee
Posts.Title: Bisphosphonate side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Bon Yes that has eased my mind loads. I have always had regular dental check ups and no problems for years so hopefully will continue that way. I just wondered if it could happen out of the blue or is it always associated with extractions - which it seems to be. Thank you so much for your reply. Hope you stay well. Love Dee xx
Posts.Title: Bisphosphonate side effects

Posts.Content: Hi Chockie I am taking aspirin only because I read somewhere it can help reduce chance of recurrence. I discussed it with onc and she agreed for me to be prescribed it. Same with the biphosphonates - I suggested it to her and she agreed - think she must be tired of me reading things ! My lobular was found when i noticed dimpling but no lump was ever felt - it is a sly bugger !! Take care Love Dee
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Chockie I was diagnosed with invasive lobular breast cancer almost 2 years ago and I still see my oncologist every 3 months for a chat and a check up. I also have yearly MRI on my remaining breast as my lobular was not picked up on a mammogram. I am not sure of the chance of recurrence but will ask next time I see her. I take a daily aspirin,letrozole and have just started 6 monthly infusions of biphospanates all to try and keep this evil disease at bay. It sounds like you have been let down by your team and would recommend ringing BCN and organising a check up and get back into the system. Good luck and hope you keep well
Posts.Title: Invasive lobular cancer

Posts.Content: Hi. I have just finished treatment for lobular breast cancer(4 weeks since last rads) had chemo first then left mastectomy.rads and now on Letrozole. My query is oncologist said she will see me every 3 months but no scans of any sort planned ( apart from yearly mammograms and MRI scans ) so how will she know if it has spread by just asking me how I feel ? Thank you for any replies as feeling bit lost and confused. Dee
Posts.Title: How do you know if you have mets

Posts.Content: Thank you very much for all your replies.
Posts.Title: How do you know if you have mets

Posts.Content: Just booked annual policy for Europe for hubby and myself for £71 with Eurotunnel. All they ask is would your doctor state you were fit to travel. You do not have to be travelling through the tunnel to use them. Hope this helps Dee
Posts.Title: Travel insurance recommendations for Europe

Posts.Content: Hi. I had my 3rd infusion on Tuesday and once again no side effects at all. Good luck with yours. xx
Posts.Title: Bones
